data.title: Where are the Love Actually cast now? From tragic death to X Factor blow and Masked Singer reveal
data.meta_description: Love Actually, released back in 2003, quickly established itself as a Christmas classic for many people
data.text:
Get ready to feel really old as Love Actually turns EIGHTEEN this year, having been released many moons ago now back in 2003.

Richard Curtis, the man who previously gave us Four Weddings and A Funeral and Bridget Jones, assembled a star-studded cast to give us a movie which very swiftly established itself as a Christmas classic.

And for many people, it still wouldn't be Christmas without at least one watch of Love Actually before Santa comes, usually when tying to wrap presents or clutching a glass of Baileys.

READ MORE: Iconic Christmas TV moments from EastEnders to Vicar of Dibley

Love Actually had everything from a Prime Minister the country loved (let's not go there right now!) to a youngster with a huge crush on 'the hottest girl' in school while trying to get over his mum's death and an ageing rocker intent on landing the Christmas number 1 - enter a young looking Ant and Dec to conduct a very awkward TV interview!

As we all get set to give it another watch, we look at what has happened to the cast, minus a few of the biggest stars ,in an article that is tinged with sadness.

Alan Rickman

Already an acting great well before Love Actually, thanks to roles in Die Hard (yes it IS a Christmas film!) and Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, Alan became the man we all loved to hate as his character Harry dared to have his head turned by secretary Mia in the run up to Christmas.

None of us will ever forget the moment, Harry's wife Karen opened a Christmas present fully expecting it to be a beautiful necklace, only for it to be a Joni Mitchell CD, with the camera the cutting to Mia wearing said necklace.

One of this country's finest actors, Alan sadly passed away in 2016 at the age of 69 after a battle with pancreatic cancer.

While we'll always hate Harry, Alan is a legend that will never be forgotten.

Olivia Olson

Get ready for this - the young actress who played little Sam's love interest Joanna is now a 29-year-old!

Olivia stunned British TV viewers when she appeared on screens 16 years after Love Actually as a contestant on X Factor Celebrity in 2019.

Reacting to her being on the show, another reacted "Now I feel really really old. Yes that is the girl from Love Actually" and another commenting " if Love Actually girl doesn't sing All I Want For Christmas in a few weeks, I'll cry."

Sadly for Olivia, her stint on The X Factor didn't last long as she was voted off instead of Martin Bashir, despite him forgetting his words.

She struggled to hide her shock and upset at the result, with the outcome seeing Simon Cowell face the wrath of many ITV viewers.

Thomas Sangster

Without a doubt THE most lovable character from the film, Sam gave Thomas his breakout role in 2003.

His relationship with on-screen dad Liam Neeson gave us some moving and hilarious scenes and then came Sam's famous airport dash to get to Joanna before she go on her flight to America.

While other child stars try and shed their past projects, Thomas, now THIRTY ONE years old, has admitted he loves being known as 'the little boy from Love Actually.'

Since its release, Thomas has continued to work in the industry appearing in Nanny McPhee, Death of Superhero and Nowhere Boy, in which he played Beatles icon Paul McCartney.

In 2020 he was nominated for an Emmy Award for his role in hit Netflix series The Queen's Gambit.

Martine McCutcheon

Martine landed the role of Downing Street staff member Natalie, five years on from making a tragic exit from EastEnders, after her character Tiffany was ran over by Frank Butcher on New Year's Eve 1998 as she chased after Grant Mitchell.

After leaving the soap, Martine scored a huge number 1 with Perfect Moment, with hits like I've Got You and I'm Over You following in its footsteps.

She made a music comeback in 2017 with album Lost and Found, before releasing a Christmas EP last year.

And, at the star of 2021, Martine was unmasked as the Swan on hit ITV show The Masked Singer, with many viewers gutted she left the competition so early.

Emma Thompson

Like her on-screen husband Alan Rickman, Emma was already a well established star before Richard Curtis came calling for Love Actually, thanks to roles in hit films like Sense & Sensibility.

Two years on from her emotionally charged star turn as Karen, Emma joined forces with Thomas Sangster to take the lead in Nanny McPhee.

And she was clearly bitten by the Christmas movie bug after Love Actually as Emma also had a part in 2019's Last Christmas.

After supporting husband Greg Wise on Strictly, Emma was last seen on screen at An Audience With Adele, with viewers absolutely loving her enthusiastic dancing in the crowd.

Lucia Monez

Portugese star Lucia got her big acting break in 2003, taking on the role of Colin Firth's character Jamie's employee turned love interest, giving Love Actually one of its sweetest moments when Jamie hunted Aurelia down to propose.

A little known fact about Lucia is that she represented Portugal at Eurovision in 1996.

She has since returned to music and has now released five albums.

Like a number of the cast, Lucia returned for a Red Nose Day special in 2017.

Kris Marshall

Kris' big movie role in Love Actually as self-confessed 'god of sex' Colin Frissell, came hot on heels of him landing a TV break on BBC's My Family.

After Colin's memorable trans-Atlantic festive jaunt in Love Actually left viewers in hysterics, Kris, who is now 48, has gone onto star in drama series Murder City, Citizen Khan and Death in Paradise.

Andrew Lincoln

Already well known for being in Channel 4's Teachers and BBC 90s cult hit This Life, after Love Actually, Andrew will always be known as the 'to me your are perfect' guy, thanks to his sweet, but let's be honest, rather creepy doorstep declaration of love to Kiera Knightley's character with words on big bits of card.

Andrew made a huge name for himself all the other world after being cast in smash hit series The Walking Dead in the main role of Rick Grimes, which won him a coveted People's Choice award in the States.

Hugh Grant

Clearly a favourite of Richard Curtis, Hugh stole the hearts of the nation both on screen and off it as Prime Minister David, who did the unthinkable and put his foot down against the US President, all while falling for his assistant Natalie.

After Love Actually, Hugh rounded out the 2000s with roles in films Music & Lyrics and Did You Hear About The Morgans, alongside Drew Barrymore and Sarah Jessica Parker respectively.

More recently Hugh starred alongside Nicole Kidman in TV series The Undoing, for which he received SAG and Golden Globe nominations.

Laura Linney

An employee of Alan Rickman's Harry, Laura's character Sarah fell head over heels in love with her co-worker Karl.

The path to romance didn't run smoothly though as Sarah also had to look after he troubled brother Michael, who rang her in distress right at the moment when she and Karl finally got close.

Laura's career has gone from strength to strength since Love Actually and having starred in the likes of Tales of the City and Ozark, has won two Golden Globe Awards and four Primetime Emmy Awards, and has also been nominated for three Academy Awards and five Tony Awards.

Bill Nighy

Aaahh Mr Billy Mack himself, who dared to take on boyband heavyweights Blue for the Christmas number 1 spot and won!

Bill's reworking of Wet Wet Wet's Love is All Around is a song families still play to this date at Christmas and, since his Love Actually star turn, acclaimed actor Bill has gone onto star in Hot Fuzz, Notes On A Scandal and The Boat That Rocked.

He also took a role in another festive film, Arthur Christmas in 2011.

Love Actually is actually on ITV at 10.40pm on Christmas Day if you fancy rounding off your festivities with Hugh, Martine, Emma and co.
